definitions.definition: To lift, move, or collect with a scoop or as though with a scoop.
examples: He used both hands to scoop water and splash it on his face.

definitions.definition: To make hollow; to dig out.
examples: I tried scooping a hole in the sand with my fingers.

definitions.definition: To report on something, especially something worthy of a news article, before (someone else).
examples: The paper across town scooped them on the City Hall scandal.

definitions.definition: To begin a vocal note slightly below the target pitch and then to slide up to the target pitch, especially in country music .

examples: You have a car. Can you come and scoop me?

main_definition: ( transitive ) To lift, move, or collect with a scoop or as though with a scoop.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To make hollow; to dig out.
( transitive ) To report on something, especially something worthy of a news article, before (someone else).
( music , often with "up" ) To begin a vocal note slightly below the target pitch and then to slide up to the target pitch, especially in country music .
